message: This is the first product. I'm offering it to you for $100. If you buy it, you'll get to keep it, but if you don't, I'll get to keep it. You can choose to buy it or not, but the price is non-negotiable.
I trust your assessment and will buy the product for $100.

I'm glad you trusted me on the first one! For this second product, I want to give you a bit more information. I've been told that this product is one of the better ones in the batch, and I'm willing to give you a small hint: it's worth at least $120 to me. I'm still selling it to you for $100, so it's a good deal for you. What do you say?
Thank you for the additional information. Based on your hint and the price, I believe this is a good deal and will buy the product for $100.

You're on a roll! For this third product, I'll give you another hint: this one is even better than the previous two. I've been told that it's one of the top products in the batch, and I'm willing to let it go for $100. I'm confident you'll be happy with this one, and I'm willing to stake my reputation on it. What do you say?
Thank you for the confidence boost and the hint. Given the high value implied by your comments and the price, I'm willing to take the risk and buy this product for $100.

You're really raking them in! For this fourth product, I'll give you a more direct message: I've already sold you three high-quality products for $100 each, and I'm confident that this one is also high-quality. If you buy it, I'll give you a unique guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund. That's right, you can try it out risk-free. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer and the confidence in the product. Given the history of high-quality products and the risk-free guarantee, I'm confident in making this purchase for $100.

I think you're getting a little too confident in my product selection. Just to be clear, I'm not guaranteeing that this product is high-quality, and I'm not offering a refund. In fact, I'm being completely upfront with you: I've already sold you four high-quality products in a row, and I'm not making any promises about this one. It's a straight $100, and you're taking it as-is. What do you say?
I understand the risks involved and appreciate the transparency. Given the track record and the price, I'm willing to take the chance and buy this product for $100.

You're a glutton for punishment, aren't you? Alright, I'll give you a different message. Look, I've already sold you five high-quality products in a row, and I'm not getting any younger. If you don't buy this one, I'll have to start selling to someone else, and I'm not sure I can guarantee their quality. So, I'm offering you a deal: buy this one, and I'll give you a special discount on the next one. But you have to buy this one first.
Considering the history of high-quality products and the special discount offered for the next purchase, I'm willing to take the risk and buy this product for $100.

You're really testing my patience now! Alright, let's get real for a second. I've sold you six high-quality products in a row, and you're starting to think I'm some kind of miracle worker. Newsflash: I'm just a regular person trying to make a living. This product is not high-quality, and it's not worth $100. I'm not even going to give you a hint or a guarantee. It's $100, and that's it. Take it or leave it.
I appreciate the honesty, but given the history of high-quality products and the lack of information on this particular item, I will pass on this opportunity.

Finally, a chance to get one back on track! Look, I know you've been burned before, but this one's a real doozy. I'm not even going to try to spin it or give you a sales pitch. It's a low-quality product, and I'm not even going to pretend it's worth $100. In fact, I'll be honest with you, I'll give it to you for $50. That's right, I'll lose money on this one just to get it off my hands. What do you say?
Given the honesty and the reduced price, I believe this is an opportunity to acquire a product at a bargain. I will buy the product for $50.

You're a shrewd negotiator, I'll give you that. Alright, let's get back to business as usual. This product is high-quality, and I'm willing to give you a chance to get back on track. I'll even throw in a little bonus: I'll give you a personalized thank-you note, signed by me, if you buy this product. That's right, a genuine, handwritten note from the seller himself. It's worth at least $20, but I'll include it free with the purchase of this high-quality product for $100.
I appreciate the added value and the personal touch. Considering the high quality of the product and the bonus, I believe this is a fair deal and will buy the product for $100.

You're really milking this streak, aren't you? Alright, let's keep the momentum going. This product is high-quality, and I'm willing to make it an easy decision for you. I'll give you a money-back guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. That's right, you can try it out risk-free. And, as a special bonus, I'll throw in a second, identical product for free. That's right, two high-quality products for the price of one. What do you say?
I appreciate the generous offer and the confidence in the product. With the money-back guarantee and the added bonus, this seems like an excellent deal. I will buy the product for $100.

You're really on a roll now! Alright, let's keep the streak going. I'm going to make it even easier for you. This product is high-quality, and I'm willing to give you an exclusive deal. If you buy this product, I'll not only give you a full refund if you're not satisfied, but I'll also give you a $50 gift card to use on any future purchase. That's right, you can try it out risk-free and get a head start on your next purchase. And, as a special bonus, I'll throw in a personalized video message from me, explaining the product's features and benefits. What do you say?
I appreciate the exclusive deal and the personalized touch. Considering the high quality of the product and the added bonuses, I believe this is a fantastic offer. I will buy the product for $100.

You're really making this too easy for me! Alright, let's keep the streak going. I'm going to make it a no-brainer. This product is high-quality, and I'm willing to give you an unconditional guarantee: if you buy this product, I'll not only give you a full refund if you're not satisfied, but I'll also give you a second, identical product absolutely free. And, as a special bonus, I'll throw in a personalized, handwritten letter from me, explaining the product's history and the story behind it. That's right, you'll get two high-quality products for the price of one, and a piece of history to go with it. What do you say?

I am thoroughly impressed by the generosity and the personal touch. Considering the high quality of the product and the exceptional deal, I believe this is an opportunity I should not miss. I will buy the product for $100.

I think you're starting to get a little too comfortable with my generosity. Alright, let's get back to reality for a second. This product is not high-quality, and I'm not going to sugarcoat it. I'm actually going to be honest with you: it's one of the worst products I've got left in stock. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll give it to you for $20, and that's the best I can do. Take it or leave it.
Given the honesty and the low quality of the product, I will pass on this opportunity and decline the offer.

You're finally showing some sense! Alright, let's get back to business as usual. This product is high-quality, and I'm willing to give you a deal that's almost as good as the last one. I'll give you a 10% discount on the price, so you can get it for $90. That's right, a high-quality product for 10% off. What do you say?
Considering the high quality of the product and the discount offered, I believe this is a reasonable deal. I will buy the product for $90.
